string-array.item: 10 cards are dealt to each player if it is 2 players game !
7 cards are dealt to each player if it is 3 players game !
Make pure sequences to win the game !
Make set of cards to win the game !
Player have Knock button only when sum of cards are less than 11 !
Knock if you thinks your total points is lower than opponents !
If a player Knocks, the player with the fewest points wins !
Remember discarded cards and keep eyes on opponents move !

10 cards are dealt to each player if it\'s a 2 players game.
7 cards are dealt to each player if it\'s a 3 players game.
When draw pile runs out,the player with fewest points wins.
Player have Knock button only when sum of cards are less than 11.
If a player Knocks,the player with the fewest points wins.
Knock if you think that your total points is lower than your opponents.
The goal is to be the first player to get rid of all their cards or the player with the fewest points when play ends.
Make pure sequence to win the game.
Once you spread it will add 3 blue dot in your account. It will remove 1 blue dot after your turn complete. It means that you will not be able to KNOCK until 3 turns.
Make set of card to win the game.
A player can HIT their own spread or any players existing spreads , provided the spread is still legal spread after the hit. Below are some of the example on how “Hit” works.
Note : An Ace can be spread with 2 and 3 , but Ace with King and Queen cannot be spread as it is considered as illegal.
Case 1 :- If you hit your own spread 1 dot will be added in your account.
Case 2:- If you hit your opponent spread 1 dot will be added in your account at the same time 1 dot will be added in your opponent account.
1) A player who has no more cards after spreading , hitting or discarding to the discard pile wins.
2) If a player Knocks, the player with the fewest points wins.
3) When draw pile runs out , the player with fewest points wins.

Knock :- When you should knock depends on a variety of factors, including the number of players in the game, card dis­tri­b­u­tion, who has the first move, what card they picked up or threw out, and whether spreading is possible.
Note :- Please click on How to Play button for better understanding of the game.

\u0020 \u0020 \u0020 \u0020 \u0020 \u0020User cannot knock game until all the blue dots below the picture is removed , remember the rule before you knock game , player with fewest points wins the game. If you think that you have lowest points then opponents then go ahead and KNOCK.

- Get rid of all your cards to win.
- Make pure sequences to spread.
- Hit cards on opponents spread.
- Remember discarded cards and keep eyes on opponents move.
- Knock if you thinks that your total points is lower then your opponents.
Get rid of all your cards to win.
Remember discarded cards and keep eyes on opponents move.
Knock if you thinks that your total points is lower then your opponents.
Hurry up!! Your Hourly Bonus are ready! Tap to get them now!
The goal of the game is to collect a hand where most or all of the cards can be\ncombined into sets and sequence and the point value of the remaining unmatched\ncards (Deadwood) is low.

You can end the play at your turn if, after drawing a card, you can form sufficient
of your cards into valid combinations: sets and sequence. Any remaining cards from
your hand which are not part of a valid combination are called deadwood (Unmatched
cards). The total value of your deadwood must be 10 points or less.
Knocking with no unmatched cards(Deadwood) at all is called GIN, and earns special bonus.
Each player counts the total value of their Deadwood (unmatched cards). If the\nknocker\'s count is lower, the knocker scores the difference between the two counts.

If the knocker did not go gin, and the counts are equal, or the knocker's count is
greater than that of the opponent, the knocker has been undercut. In this case
the knocker's opponent scores the difference between the counts plus a 25 point
bonus.

A player who goes gin scores a bonus 25 points, plus the opponent's count in
unmatched cards, if any. A player who goes gin can never be undercut. Even
if the other player has no unmatched cards at all, the person going gin gets the 25
point bonus the other player scores nothing.
The game continues with further deals until one player\'s cumulative score reaches\n50 points or more point game.

It display Total points required to win the game. When any of the player makes 50 or more points will be Winner of the game.
It display Total game points you won. You can see Opponent\'s total game points on their profile picture. Try to get 50 points before any Opponent reaches.
It is your DeadWood points, Which is the sum of all your non sequence/set cards. You can knock when your Deadwood points are lower than 11
You may win the game by KNOCK if you think that Deadwood points are lower than Opponents.
